trans-unit.source: In this step, you create a firewall rule to open the probe port for the load-balanced endpoint (59999 as specified earlier), and another rule to open the availability group listener port.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you create a firewall rule to open the probe port for the load-balanced endpoint (59999 as specified earlier), and another rule to open the availability group listener port.

trans-unit.source: Since you created the load-balanced endpoint on the Azure VMs that contain availability group replicas, you need to open the probe port and the listener port on the respective Azure VMs.
trans-unit.target: Since you created the load-balanced endpoint on the Azure VMs that contain availability group replicas, you need to open the probe port and the listener port on the respective Azure VMs.

trans-unit.source: On VMs hosting replicas, launch Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
trans-unit.target: On VMs hosting replicas, launch Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

trans-unit.source: In the Rule Type page, select Port, then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Rule Type page, select Port, then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Protocol and Ports page, select TCP and type 59999 in the Specific local ports box.
trans-unit.target: In the Protocol and Ports page, select TCP and type 59999 in the Specific local ports box.

trans-unit.source: In the Action page, keep Allow the connection selected and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Action page, keep Allow the connection selected and click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Profile page, accept the default settings and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Profile page, accept the default settings and click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Name page, specify a rule name, such as AlwaysOn Listener Probe Port in the Name text box, and click Finish.
trans-unit.target: In the Name page, specify a rule name, such as AlwaysOn Listener Probe Port in the Name text box, and click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the above steps for the availability group listener port (as specified earlier in the $EndpointPort parameter of the script) and specify an appropriate rule name, such as AlwaysOn Listener Port.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the above steps for the availability group listener port (as specified earlier in the $EndpointPort parameter of the script) and specify an appropriate rule name, such as AlwaysOn Listener Port.
